fields.title: Live a disciplined life with these ways
fields.description:
Discipline, the term itself is very interesting, there are a lot of people all around the world struggling for this(including me).

There is a lot of research going on in this field that how we should become disciplined in our life, what is the science behind discipline and how should we instill it in ourselves.

Will power is considered to be a limited resource for a day, it’s like our mobile battery which gets charged every night.

Will power as the psychologists consider it today is like a muscle, it gets weaken if you use if extensively, but since it is a muscle it can be developed and made stronger.

Some of the points below can increase our discipline levels.

Meditation: This is #1 thing we can do to to instill discipline in ourselves.We do not need heavy training in meditation, just start with deep breathing for five minutes a day, and this can significantly densify the grey areas in our brain responsible for providing us the willpower(self discipline) needed for the day.
Exercise: Exercising is also very important for forming the new neural connections in our brain which improve our brain functioning and our discipline.
Surroundings: You cannot become disciplined if your environment promotes indiscipline, for e.g if you are thinking about dieting and filling you refrigerator with all those unhealthy foods it won’t work, you will not be able to resist these foods. So remove the things from yours surrounding which make you indiscipline.
People around you: This is also a part of yours surroundings, if you befriend people who are lazy and very undisciplined,even you will end up being one. Surround yourself with high achievers and you will eventually achieve high. This doesn’t mean that you should leave your friendship with your lazy friends, but you should just spend more time with the high achievers.
Eating what is correct: If you eat very heavy food than that will surely disturb your day’s routine and you will not be able to follow your rituals. So keep you food light.
Sleep: As suggested earlier will power is like a battery which gets charged every night so one need to have a sound sleep so that our willpower battery remains charged by the time we get up.
These were the things to increase the discipline at our mental level. For having a disciplined life we can do following things.

Get up early everyday, be sure you are not sleeping more than 8 hours a day at any cost, because more than that is not rest it’s laziness.
Be the master of your gadgets not a slave of them, use them for your benefit don’t let them destroy your time.
Turn off notifications from apps(like whatsapp, facebook or other such apps) which consume your time.
Watch less television, or eliminate it totally, watch it only if it is adding up to your productivity.
For entertainment you can listen music or read books, they are as entertaining as television.
Try to form groups for difficult things, for example if you want to do yoga everyday and you are not able to do it, then you can form a group of people who have the same goal and practice yoga with them.
Make yourself accountable, own your mistakes and correct them in future.
The above points will help you live a disciplined life and also increase your efficiency in work.

At last don’t be harsh on yourself, be compassionate to yourself, because humans have tendency to make mistakes, but we also have the power to correct them in the future.
fields.summary: Discipline, the term itself is very interesting, there are a lot of people all around the world struggling for this(including me). The above points will help you live a disciplined life and also increase your efficiency in work.

fields.title: Elements necessary to achieve discipline
fields.description:
1) Grit / Passion / Drive
The higher grit or passion you have, the higher natural discipline to pursue your goals. Even if you occasionally step aside from the right track, you will eventually get back to what you set yourself to do, because it is important to you. The levels of grit / passion are very often derived from your childhood (were you rich & spoiled or had to work hard for everything?) and the way your parents explained life to you. Later on you get influenced by your friends, student mates and colleagues.

2) Talent / complacency
People with higher talent sooner or later realize that they can accomplish solidly with smaller time investment. Gradually they push the limits of complacency further (e.g. Spending time with hobbies / games instead of learning for the exam). They feel a "bad concsious" afterwards and get very productive later on as result. Do they still succeed? Usually yes, unless they get too complacent / lazy. Is this disciplined? No. One needs to watch himself so that this does not become a problem.

3) Ambition / Joy
If you were always disciplined or set yourself higher goals on the first place, you could likely achieve more. Looking back at point 2, if you had more challenging goal, you would have likely started working on it earlier. How challenging goal you have is determined by point 1, how passionate or gritty you are about the thing.

Would having higher goals and working very disciplined towards them make you happy though? Being always too disciplined would be boring and could lead to unhappy life. Being not enough discipline will lead to fail and as a result unhappiness, too. You need to find a good balance that works for you.

4) Self-regulation
Once you figure out points 1-3 and what you eventually want in life, the self-regulation part is rather easy, because it will go naturally with your personal values. Best way how to live (seemingly) disciplined life is to pursue your passion / wants / grit, as the high passion leads to higher natural discipline. That's why "seemingly" as at that point you don't really live disciplined life but a natural happy life, despite the hard work.

On the pragmatic side of things, it helps to write down your goals and set yourself a deadline for every item. Use a pen and sheet of paper. Write down everything. You will see that you'll accomplish a lot and it feels good by ticking it done on your list, doesn't it?
fields.summary: Would having higher goals and working very disciplined towards them make you happy though? That's why "seemingly" as at that point you don't really live disciplined life but a natural happy life, despite the hard work.

fields.title: My tips to achieve self discipline
fields.description:
It really isn’t that complicated. It’s about knowing where to start.

A few tips I’ve been practicing for the past few years are these:

Self-discipline tip #1. Get smarter about maximizing your daily dose of willpower.

When we wake up, it’s not uncommon that we’re overwhelmed with the amount of things we need to do, so we end up procrastinating and postponing our tasks. That’s a critical mistake, because we all have a finite amount of willpower that takes us through the day. If you want to focus on priorities, work on them early.

Complete one task that you’ve been putting off all week before lunchtime. It’s going to take much less time than if you leave if for the evening.
Write up a weekly plan for the school or work week ahead of time. That way you won’t panic when a deadline is approaching.
Finish homework that you’ve been putting off because you’ve been watching YouTube videos. You won’t need to stay up all night making up for lost time.
Self-discipline tip #2. Take care of your basic needs first.

Before you embark on your path toward any type of achievement, it’s important to cover the basics. According to Maslow’s hierarchy of needs, that means meeting the first level of physiological needs such as food, shelter, and clothing. Here is the first opportunity where you can practice self-discipline.

Eat the right food. Eat not just to be full, but also to stay healthy and maintain your brain’s optimal performance.
Get sufficient exercise. Physical exercise is critical to performing well in every area of your life, so make sure to make it is a daily habit.
Get enough sleep. When you’re sleep-deprived, you’ll never be able to function at optimal levels, either physically and mentally. Be sure to get enough sleep.
Self-discipline tip #3. Make a new habit stick by keeping it simple.

Every habit we’d like to acquire needs self-discipline, time, and repetition. If you’re reading this, chances are you feel that it’s time to make some kind of improvement in the way you do your work. To simplify a change you’re trying to make, start with tiny steps.

Start with a micro task. It can be writing down a to-do list of what you need to accomplish in one day.
Don’t multitask. Go down your list of tasks and look at each one individually. Don’t try to do a few things in the same hour.
Divide your time into manageable chunks. Use the Pomodoro techniqueto maximize time and keep yourself on track.
Self-discipline tip #4. Practice saying no more often.

If you frequently find yourself running out of time to do what you need to do, it probably means you’re wasting time and energy on things that are not that important in the long run. Start building up your “no muscle” in small ways each day.

When you’re in the middle of finishing up a project and a friend calls to talk, it doesn’t mean you should drop everything and do it. It’s okay to politely say no, ask to call them later, and stay focused on your goal.
When you are working and your mobile phone lights up with a notification of a Facebook or Instagram update, don’t look at it. Keep your phone away from you when you’re working, and check it after you’ve completed a task.
Self-discipline tip #5. Make a specific commitment to yourself.

Commitments aren’t just promises you make to other people. You can — and should — make them first to yourself. A great way to begin is to define a very specific goal you want to achieve in a certain time frame. Here are a few examples of what you can commit to. Write it down in your journal, or write it on a large sheet of paper and hang it on your bedroom wall so you see it each day.

I am committed to focusing on my studies in the next 30 days so that I can pass all three of my exams with top marks.
I am committed to completing my to-do list for today before I turn on the TV so that I don’t have to add more things to my work agenda tomorrow.
I am committed to keeping my goals so that I can make progress in my work or school and be proud of what I’ve done.
fields.summary: Physical exercise is critical to performing well in every area of your life, so make sure to make it is a daily habit. If you’re reading this, chances are you feel that it’s time to make some kind of improvement in the way you do your work. If you frequently find yourself running out of time to do what you need to do, it probably means you’re wasting time and energy on things that are not that important in the long run. A great way to begin is to define a very specific goal you want to achieve in a certain time frame. It’s going to take much less time than if you leave if for the evening.

fields.title: Ultimate guide to self-control and discipline
fields.description:
In a society that lives and breathes instant gratification, developing self discipline is both the most worthwhile and most difficult task that you can undertake.

I know this from personal experience…

Five years ago, I was a lazy, depressed, alcoholic who worked a job that he hated, regularly watched porn and played video games to excess and had 0 confidence and self worth.

Today, after cultivating serious self discipline, I own a high performance coaching company on track for 7-figures, have built a body that I am incredibly proud of, have an incredible girlfriend, and live a life of abundance and joy everyday.

But it wasn’t easy.

It required massive discipline to make this transformation.

Luckily, along the way, I found a simple formula for achieving massive levels of discipline fast!

Here it is

I. It All Start with “Why”

When I went from playing video games and watching porn for hours a day to doing nothing but hustling on my business, I didn’t do it because it felt good or because it was easy… I did it because I had no choice.

I was living on my brother’s couch, making every purchase on a credit card, and scared that I would end up on the streets.

I had a compelling “Why” that helped me develop the discipline necessary to achieve my dreams.

This is an extreme example but it illustrates the point.

Before you set out to develop discipline, you must have clear and concise reason for developing discipline.

WHY do you want to be disciplined?

Do you want financial freedom?
Do you want to have an abundant dating life
Do you want the body of your dreams?
Why is discipline a MUST for you?

Once you have your “Why” in mind, I want you to write it out and then dive into details about the feelings and results that you will have once you have developed this discipline.

For example…

“I must develop discipline so that I can enjoy an abundant financial life that allows me to travel the world, spoil my girlfriend, retire my parents, and live a high quality of life”

I also recommend creating a vision board, visualizing and meditating on your vision every day, and reading your “why” aloud..

But this is putting the cart ahead of the horse because all of these things require… You guessed it! Discipline.

Once you have your “Why” written down, here are a few more actionable ways to develop discipline.

2. Understanding Your Brain and Optimizing Your Feedback Loop

The biggest mistake most people make when they try to become more disciplined is that they bite off too much at once.

They think they can go from lazy to Navy SEAL overnight… You can’t and you will end up doing more harm than good if you even try.

Instead, you need to understand your brain and take things at an appropriate pace.

Here’s how.

Pick ONE habit (and only one) that you are going to stick with. E.g. exercise, no processed food, meditation etc.
Now, setup a trigger for that habit. So for example, if you decided to start exercising, put your shoes by your doorway as a reminder to exercise in the morning
Now make the new habit or discipline SUPER easy… I mean so fucking easy it’s not even funny. So running with the workout example, commit to doing ONE pushup.. That’s it. Put your shoes on, go to your dedicated workout spot and do one pushup… Congrats, you have now exercised. The key here is that you are doing something and developing discipline
Keep going. When you commit to ONLY doing one pushup, you are tricking your brain … If you don’t feel like working out you will think to yourself “Hell, it’s one pushup I can do that!” then you will do your pushup and think “Hmmm, I should go for 5, then 10, then 20” and before you know it you have done a whole workout.
Rinse and repeat for 21–45 days
I recommend that you use the above formula with 6–12 new habits per year.

This might not seem like a lot, but if you apply this formula (and you if you are creative you CAN apply this formula to anything) you will achieve each of those habits and discipline yourself to actually follow through instead of failing when you try and change 20 things at once.

Imagine, in 12 months, with this formula you could…

Start and stick to an exercise routine, packing on pounds of muscle or shredding fat
Eliminate junk food doubling your energy and results at the gym
Save 15% of everything you earn eliminating financial stress and concern
Wake up at 5 a.m. have time for yourself and arrive at work on time every day
Start a meditation practice and reduce your stress and anxiety
Start a side hustle and generate $1,000-$5,000/month in residual income
Take daily cold showers increasing your grit, resilience, and testosterone levels
Start a daily gratitude practice that increases your happiness and fulfillment
Eliminate any addiction
Learn a new instrument or sport
Become more productive and focused at work
Start dating high quality members of the opposite (or same.. whatever floats your boat) sex
fields.summary:
This might not seem like a lot, but if you apply this formula (and you if you are creative you CAN apply this formula to anything) you will achieve each of those habits and discipline yourself to actually follow through instead of failing when you try and change 20 things at once. So for example, if you decided to start exercising, put your shoes by your doorway as a reminder to exercise in the morning
Now make the new habit or discipline SUPER easy… I mean so fucking easy it’s not even funny. For example…

“I must develop discipline so that I can enjoy an abundant financial life that allows me to travel the world, spoil my girlfriend, retire my parents, and live a high quality of life”

I also recommend creating a vision board, visualizing and meditating on your vision every day, and reading your “why” aloud..

fields.title: Creating a healthy relationship with your children
fields.description:
In this fast changing environment the question is very valid.

Parenting has become a task!

Creating relationship with our own children is becoming very tough as they are involved in the gadgets or studying hard to achieve their academic goals or pressures.

Since we and children both are very much connected to the Machines the emotions are taking a backseat.

Now when we are understanding that because of these machines there is lack of connection. You can build connection by using following given tips:

Consciously leave gadgets or phone when are around. Even if you feel that they are not noticing or you have to break your boredom.
The first thing that children look for, is a friend in you. Because the scenario has gone where parent's duty was protecting and commanding children, now we can be closed to them only when we are friend to each other.
We need to appreciate whenever you see anything good in child so that the confidence can be boosted. And further they can show us the improvement they make on the point that was appreciated. Or come up with some more reasons to be appreciated. This develops a habit of looking at the good things in others and you can see a change in them in some days that they will also start appreciating you as a parent, as a person and as friend.
See that whether your child is more into activities (try to do things of his own), listening music /talking/sharing stories a lot or Is high on watching Movies /Reading comics. With this we can come to know whether my child is more so Visual. Auditory or kinesthetic as preferences. After understanding his preferences mode we can connect with them very easily. By showing respect to there preferred mode.
We can start with these tips and then see how the relationship is improved.

Have patience for results.
fields.summary: This develops a habit of looking at the good things in others and you can see a change in them in some days that they will also start appreciating you as a parent, as a person and as friend. We need to appreciate whenever you see anything good in child so that the confidence can be boosted.

fields.title: Proper relationship between love and discipline
fields.description:
A2A.

We humans tend to long for what we don’t have. Those who live in villages long for city life, while those living in cities plan getaways to enjoy village life. Similarly, based on lifetime experiences, everyone has their own, unique set of desires.

Is there a relationship between love and discipline? Yes and No.

See, love isn’t an emotion in itself, even though it guides all sort of emotions in us. Think of love as a motivation in this case - which motivates a person to do things that they wouldn’t normally do, and even find joy and satisfaction in it.

Now, “Discipline” - if you are talking about the BDSM’s Discipline, well it’s just that one of the two partners either want to dominate or want to be dominated. Other partner, inclined to satisfy that wish/desire participates in it as well. Is it love? Yes! But only if it gives one of the two partners the happiness and satisfaction. The other partner finds comfort in knowing that their act made their partner happy.

If you are talking about “discipline” in general sense, well that again depends on partner. For someone whose partner likes to keep things organised and isn’t a fan of chaos, his or her partner would organise his/her methods (that you can call as discipline) in order to keep their partner happy. But again, Love acts just as motivation here.

For two people who neither want to be dominated or to dominate other or fan of order, discipline wouldn’t matter at all.
fields.summary: Think of love as a motivation in this case - which motivates a person to do things that they wouldn’t normally do, and even find joy and satisfaction in it.

fields.title: Posting about my relationships online
fields.description:
Yes. I post about my relationships online. I post photos of my partners online, when they are okay with that. I speak about my relationships at conferences and workshops. I tell stories about my sex life in front of an audience at Bawdy Storytelling. I have written two books about my relationships.

Why?

Several reasons.

First, I think that shame about sex and relationships is harmful. I think many people are afraid or embarrassed by things they feel and do that are common, healthy, and ordinary. I think that fear and shame causes a lot of damage.

Second, I believe authenticity, vulnerability, and openness are absolutely vital to a healthy relationship, and I believe that by modeling vulnerability and openness, I can help show people that it's okay.

Third, I believe that abusive relationships are incredibly, incredibly common. I believe that many people who are being abused do not know they are being abused. I believe that abuse thrives in dark corners and hidden places. When we talk openly about relationships, and especially about what healthy relationships look like, we shine light into those dark corners and let people who don't know they are being abused see what is happening. (When Eve and I published our book More Than Two, something happened that we would never have imagined. People started writing to us and coming up to us at book events saying “thank you so much for writing that book. It helped me to see that my relationship was not healthy and I was being mistreated. That let me end the relationship, and now my romantic life is healthier.”)

Finally, there is still a huge amount of bigotry about non-traditional relationships. By being open about my relationships, I help to dispel some of that prejudice and help to normalize non-traditional romantic choices. That helps other people who are in non-traditional relationships but can't be open about it because of fear of discrimination.
fields.summary:
When we talk openly about relationships, and especially about what healthy relationships look like, we shine light into those dark corners and let people who don't know they are being abused see what is happening. That let me end the relationship, and now my romantic life is healthier.”)

Finally, there is still a huge amount of bigotry about non-traditional relationships.

fields.title: People about their relationships online
fields.description:
Like you, I keep my relationship off social 99% of the time. So I can only speculate as to why people share about their significant other so much. Here are a few ideas:

They want people to know they're in a relationship. Maybe they're proud to have found somebody.
They are so so in love with this other person that they can't help but shout it out to the world.
They think that sharing on social means that they really care more than people who don't share.
They are the type of person who shares everything so the relationship pics just happen to be part of that.
They want to make single people jealous.
They don't feel comfortable sharing anything else about themselves or their interests alone.
The list can go on and on. There's no right answer.
fields.summary:
Here are a few ideas:

They want people to know they're in a relationship.

fields.title: Best relationship advice in my opinion
fields.description:
Have you ever asked yourself, “What is the fundamental reason of seeking a relationship? “ Because if you do not have any kind of relationship in life, you become depressed. So, that means the reason you are seeking relationship is to be happy and joyful! In other words you are trying to use others as a source of your happiness..

So, when you try to use others for your source of happiness that means Your Happiness is Not on Self-Start.

So, the advice I am going to share with you is by Jaggi Vasudev. Commonly known as Sadhguru; he is an Indian yogi, mystic and New York Times bestselling author.

“Lets say you bought a car in 40s. Along with car you need to get two servants beacause in the morning you need to push start. If you bought a car in 50s, one servant would do since it was crank start. Now-a-days, all the automobiles are self-start. But our happiness is still on push start. Somebody has to push it a little bit otherwise it won’t get started. “


What happens when you self-start your happiness?
If you are happy by your own nature, then relationships become a means for one to express one's happiness and not to seek happiness. If you are forming relationships to seek happiness and trying to squeeze happiness out of somebody and that person is trying to squeeze happiness out of you. Now, this is going to be a painful relationship after sometime.

If you have become a joy by yourself and you are forming relationships because you want to express your happiness, nobody is gonna complain about you. Because you are the process of expressing your joy and not seeking joy from the other person.

Thus, if your life becomes an expression of your joy not in pursuit of happiness then relationships will be naturally wonderful.


One can hold a million relationships and still hold them good. The whole circus of trying to fulfil some other person’s expectations does not arise. Because if you are an expression of joy, anyway they want to be with you. If you are trying to extract joy from them, then they are going to avoid you. Shifting your life from persuit of happiness to an expression of joyfulness is what need to happen and then relationships really work on all levels.
fields.summary: If you are happy by your own nature, then relationships become a means for one to express one's happiness and not to seek happiness. So, when you try to use others for your source of happiness that means Your Happiness is Not on Self-Start.

fields.title: My experiences in relationships with various people
fields.description:
I've been in many physically and mentally abusive relationships my whole life from the relationships with my parents to boyfriends. Let's start the amazing hell I call my life the last couple years…. ( Shortened because nobody has time for that)

FATHER- left when I was very young and was in and out of my life due to the fact I was too much like my mother for him to be able to stand which led to emotional abusive things being said to me because he knew it would bother me which would make me lash out on my mom for making me that way and leading my father to find that imperfection in me.

MOTHER- thoughout my whole life I was physically and mentally abused. From being hit by metal belts till there was red welts to being pulled around the house by my hair… to being pointed out that I was bigger because I got it from my father and how I was just like my father so I would never be enough for her because all she saw was my father every time she looked at me.

FIRST LOVE S.L.M.- we met in the 7th grade in math class my first day at the new school. He was writing me notes and putting them in my backpack and I'd find them as soon as I opened my bag for my next class. He would write me cute things that at seemed to brighten my day and he was the first person at the new school to actually notice me… then he wasn't in class for the next two weeks I was confused…. He came back and I asked where he was and he told me he spent two weeks in juvi for charges he got before I moved…. Me being 7th grade me loving “ bad boys “ I had to have him. And I did after awhile. We became close to the point his parents and siblings were like my own. I was happy till the first time we got into a fight and he hit me. Little did I know this was only the beginning of a long abusive relationship. Many punches were thrown, threats were made and names were called in this relationship and at the end it was just time to walk away. No woman should ever be treated like that.

MY SECOND RELATIONSHIP W.J.F.B.-

• part 1- 2013 I started talking to a boy I went to middle School with and of course he was the school badass…. Of course I had to have him because I knew I couldn't…. We started dating over Facebook while I lived an hour away. I ended up running away with him for a few days and worried the people who cared for me sick. I thought nobody would care if I took of with a boy but there were posters with our faces everywhere… then I came home and we adventually stopped talking for almost 3 years….

• part 2- I'm now 16 at this point. We started talking again. My mom started being very abusive again and I was in a hard place in my life dealing with a cocaine problem ( we will get to later) and out of a heartbreak from the guy we will talk about next. I ended up moving in with his friend and a month later getting our own place together. Then started the relationship that ruined alot. He had a previous drug problem but now only smoked marijuana and got to the point when he couldn't smoke he became mean and verbally and physically abusive…. From grabbing me, pulling my hair, punching me, screaming in my face and calling me names to the swing me around. I then was afraid to leave because he had threatened my life and his own if I did. Adventually I said Enough was enough after being homeless, having a drug problem and loosing my family and everything I ever loved or had in life and being beat on and screamed at for years….

MY NEXT RELATIONSHIP D.B.H- This one wasn't too terrible I guess u could say… He treated me like a queen and got me anything I wanted but only to cover up that he was cheating on me and lying to me our whole relationship….

MY LAST “ RELATIONSHIP ( not really dating) Q.A-

We talked for quite awhile on and off he was my best friend I could talk to him about anything but he was drunk most of the time or high…. We became close. He got me hooked on cocaine and it was a struggle to stop. But he was unhealthy. He was toxic. So I refused to ever be with him. Then he did something I could never forgive…. I got clean and started talking to an amazing man ( My current) and he had the nerve to talk about him and his son and I refused to ever talk to him again…. I'll never speak to him again but for that.

MY CURRENT-

I live with him and his amazing family who treats me like I'm part it. I fall asleep every night next to a man who loves me for everything that I am and everything that I'm not because we both have imperfections… he treats me like his queen and makes sure I feel loved and cared for every day. He's there for me no matter what I'm going through. He's a goof ball and makes me smile every day. Hes my best friend. He's the one I can always count on. I honestly love this man with all of my heart. It's like every time my heart beats it for him and his amazing little boy even though my heart skips one every time he looks me in the eyes and tells me he loves me. Like every breath is for him even when he takes it away with random kisses. He's all I've ever wanted and more than I could ever ask for. He's such an amazing man. I'm so happy I met him. I don't know what I'd do without his crazy butt in my life….. this man is literally my whole world. Nobody else matters but him and his son. I don't care about anything else but those two. I love those to sooooooooooo much more that they could ever imagine. I appreciate everything my man does for me and I couldn't thank him for everything he does. He's truly the man who stole my heart and I love it because I wouldn't have gave it to anyone else if I had the choice. He's my baby. He made me realize what love really is and how a woman should be treated. I know at times he doesn't understand why I flinch when he moves a certain way just due to my past of abuse or why I build up my walls so high or why I get hurt over certain stupid things it's just my past but he excepts it and works with me through it and makes sure I know he will never do that to me and how much I mean to him…. He's my definition of perfect because everyone has their own vision of perfect. You just have to stop trying to find it and let it find you.

My experience with relationships are terrible but I found one who is unlike any other and he's my king and I'm his queen and I couldn't be happier. Find what makes you happy.

fields.title: Top 5 tips on achieving success
fields.description:
Read. Some people say they hate to read. That's 100% their own fault. There are so many books out there on so many different subjects. Read something or substance. Not twitter or FB or People magazine but actual books that took people time and effort and knowledge to write.
Find something you're willing to work hard for. For the sake of argument we'll just title this “passion”. Literally just start with something. You watched Wolf of Wall Street and want to be an investment banker, start learning finance. You think hacking looks cool in movies and love reading news on it, start learning how to hack. Weed out what you don't want to do when things get tough versus what you would keep doing. Once you find that one thing, create a short, medium and long term plan. Things can change, but having some type of plan is necessary.
Meet people. This is so broad but just like finding “passion”, just start. Any way you can. I knew a guy who was starting learning to code, but was not in school. He started going to any club, meet-up, conventions whenever he could. He would go up to people and ask specific questions that might lead to a conversation and then possibly a relationship. It's a skill. Work at it. Do what I call effective discussion. It's essentially where you are talking to someone with a specific purpose in mind. Like getting a girls number, asking a sales associate for a lower price, or trying to get a reference on your resume.
To do list. Every night before bed, create a to-do list fon the next day. Finish all those things. You either want it or you don't. Those that want it will finish the to-do list. Just try not to swamp yourself with unnecessary tasks. Start with the most important and work your way down.
Take challenges head on. Self positive talk. Stop viewing things as obstacles and more as opportunities. This just comes with experience and getting out of your comfort zone one small step at a time.
Baby steps. You can't change overnight so don't try. Read ten pages every day; accomplish your to-do list; learn something new every day and write it down at night; try to talk to one new person every day.

No one is born thinking, I'll be an expert at that. So don't worry about getting it all together in a weeks worth of time. Take it slow, find a subject your passionate at, and work at it a little bit every day.
fields.summary: Take it slow, find a subject your passionate at, and work at it a little bit every day. Read ten pages every day; accomplish your to-do list; learn something new every day and write it down at night; try to talk to one new person every day. He would go up to people and ask specific questions that might lead to a conversation and then possibly a relationship. This just comes with experience and getting out of your comfort zone one small step at a time.

fields.title: My habits to achieve success
fields.description:
Successful people are outliers, who recognize their inherent talent and strengths, that generates impact. With such talents they can generate impact for the society, or only for themselves.
Because they recognize their talents at the right time, they have an inherent motivation to do some great work towards doing something better than a large population, and they have an advantage of time.
Their motivation keeps steering them towards increasing knowledge and skills to improve further on the talent.
They increase enough knowledge by their hard work and by getting mentors, which makes them even better at something.
They inspire and lead others, and when motivation is not enough, they fall back to discipline.
They keep going towards their bigger dreams, and they believe in themselves so much so that others believe in them.
They try to maximize their personal utility by making themselves as happy as possible by being in every correct possible circle that contributes to the venn diagram that brings success. This post will elaborate on it.
They make conscious choices and attempts towards maximizing this utility.
They develop micro habits that can be different from others, and specific only to them that maximize this utility.
Whether those habits are similar to those of others, shared and followed by others is immaterial to them.
They do those things because they love to do those things.
According to the needs and requirements they change, adapt and develop newer and more habits. Sometimes they selectively drop their habits.
They are not just liked by others, they are loved and worshiped.
fields.summary: They increase enough knowledge by their hard work and by getting mentors, which makes them even better at something.

fields.title: Achieving a successful career
fields.description:
Right after you pass out tenth standard, you should have a clear idea or at least have an idea as to what your strengths and weaknesses are. I know it's difficult to assess at that age. But to be more successful it's important to know what exactly you want at that age. It will pave the way to build a strong Base for your career.

I agree it's the duty of the schools to let know the child as to what he or she can become with the amount of inclination at that particular age. But sadly our schools are unable to do that. And even parents are unable to guide their children, despite their so called education.

Career counselling as a profession is not that sought after in a country like India. But with the Advent of Internet it has become easy for all of us to get exposed to a new world where a fifteen year old child is able to float a company and a sixty year old is motivated enough to take uphill tasks in his life.

Tips to be successful in ones career:

Hardwork will take you places. Have you ever heard about a person who got killed by hardwork?
Acquiring specialist skills is important so that you can get recognised.
Dont be afraid to travel a lot if your job demands. By travelling a person learns a lot. So, Its better to learn at company's cost.
Take time to read a lot about leadership, management skills, people skills. After a point of time, you no longer remain a trainee engineer (example), you will grow to lead a group of people.
Is time management necessary to be successful? Yes, of course if you don't manage your time, you will be on the losing side.
Failing to plan is Planning to fail. If you don't plan the things you will falter.
Having goals is important, otherwise you will end up with a life full of unfulfilled wishes.
Take time to appreciate people around you. Especially the people who are less privileged, after some time you will notice that good things coming back to you.
Talk less and listen more, you got two ears and one mouth. By this habit whenever you speak you will be respected a lot.
Try to take calculated risks in life do not get into comfort zone a dedicated stagnate at one point. Be flexible with your choices.
Try to learn a foreign language, this will certainly help you at some point or the other.
It doesn't matter who you are what you do, it's always good to stay humble.
Save for the rainy day,one fine day when you get a pink slip due to any reason, your savings will help you.
As you grow try to remove the unwanted things from your mind, I mean you should be more clear about your objectives as you age.
There is no harm in running that extra mile.
Along the way you will find many unwanted elements who will try to pull you down, you just do your work and don't get entangled in the things which don't concern you.
Commuting takes a lot of time, choose a mode of transportation which will take lesser time and if it takes a loner duration, you can utilise this time by listening to audio pep talks which will boost you to achieve your goals. Don't try to listen to these talks when you are driving your own vehicle.
Some points may seem to be insignificant, but I felt these are the generalised points which can make your journey smooth.
fields.summary: Especially the people who are less privileged, after some time you will notice that good things coming back to you. But with the Advent of Internet it has become easy for all of us to get exposed to a new world where a fifteen year old child is able to float a company and a sixty year old is motivated enough to take uphill tasks in his life. Try to take calculated risks in life do not get into comfort zone a dedicated stagnate at one point.

fields.title: Keys to a successful relationship
fields.description:
I spent a lot of time as a young man trying to understand relationships. It was a learning process. I learnt somethings and I still learn.
It took me years. Hope this helps you I am blessed to share

1. Be Honest with yourself first and know yourself : Why do you need the relationship? whats your goal for the relationship is it companionship or sex or partnership or sharing love? why do you want to commit? what are your intentions and motivations? Why did your last relationship fail? Are you using relationship to curb your loneliness or medicate your feelings? Work on your issues they are yours. Changing relationships will not make you less of an alcoholic or addict. stop the blame and be straight with yourself.

2. Learn to love , respect yourself and have your happiness generated internally : Do not have a relationship or marriage just because you think the relationship will make you happy. If you not happy on your own a relationship will not change that.

3. Observe the Parents of your dating partner or to be spouse : Many times not always though we pick up our traits from our parents and their conditioning. We can change that but we will in some or many ways be like our parents. DO NOT IGNORE THIS ! see if you can live with those behaviors or challenge them early in the dating.

4. Be Vulnerable and use I statements: If you feel mad at something your partner did.Make sure you tell them how you feel if it persists and be direct honest and make sure you use I statements.

5. Understand and Learn to Forgive: There is nothing wrong in feeling mad. But if we truly love our partner and care about the relationship we will learn to listen and understand. And forgive the ones we love , that does not mean we take abuse. It means we understand they human like us. I

6. Learn to Listen and solve conflicts : We need to not just hear but listen to each other where they are coming from , what it means to them etc. Its getting their world of perception. Its resolving conflicts as adults. you do not have to be perfect realize you both human. STAY PRESENT to his or her emotions, feelings and expectations NOT Just the words they saying.

7. Learn your partners love language: We all receive love and give love in different ways some by gifts. Learn you and your partners love language.
There are five primary ways in which partners give and receive love.
Gifts , words of appreciation, physical touch, acts of service and quality time.
The five love languages - Gary Chapman is a good book to start.

8. Learn to take responsibility and accountability : Do not just say sorry actually meant it and say you were wrong and speak from the vulnerable place. Make sure you learn from it and take accountability for what you did. Show that you learnt from it.

9 . Remember the law of learning and growing : Two people who choose to be together will obviously be different in many ways have different parents etc. We mostly get angry cause something within us gets triggered. If i get angry fast maybe, its time to learn to be more patient. NEVER BLAME see what you can learn and if you troubled by something your partner did use Step 4. Always LOOK INSIDE FIRST ask why did this trigger me.

10. Make your relationship central not your personal EGO's : If you really value the relationship and genuinely care for the other person its an easy choice. Remember love is a choice and action. You need to recommit to it over and over and be present to why you chose that person and chose to consciously love them. LEARN to LOVE UNCONDITIONALLY if you can. In conflicts remember to both ask the question whats good for our relationship ?

11. Make sure you are aligned and not try to change your partner but accept them : Make sure you both choosing to grow spiritually,mentally and emotionally. Make sure you both at similar stages of growth in that aspect. DO NOT HOPE your partner will change or ignore something in the chemical high of the romantic phase or initial hormones. ACCEPT THEM THE WAY they are if they grow good.


12. Try to Stay present: Stay present and in the moment let yesterday and day before be bygones.if its a repeated behavior use step 4.

Lastly remember the chemicals will die and romantic love phase will end after first two years. After that its a conscious choice which you work on ,as you consciously choose to make it better. You can choose to make sex better. You can choose to love.

Will there be times your partner annoys you yes.Will you feel like leaving ? maybe that's the time to contemplate on why you chose this person and recommit your love. Your choice to love will be tested its in those moments of conflict and argument that there is opportunity to learn, love and grow.

IN THE END We all humanly doing the best we can with what we know and our experiences in the big picture and hindsight its good to always remember that when dealing with our partner and families.
fields.summary: NEVER BLAME see what you can learn and if you troubled by something your partner did use Step 4. Be Vulnerable and use I statements: If you feel mad at something your partner did.Make sure you tell them how you feel if it persists and be direct honest and make sure you use I statements. Your choice to love will be tested its in those moments of conflict and argument that there is opportunity to learn, love and grow. IN THE END We all humanly doing the best we can with what we know and our experiences in the big picture and hindsight its good to always remember that when dealing with our partner and families. Be Honest with yourself first and know yourself : Why do you need the relationship? Remember the law of learning and growing : Two people who choose to be together will obviously be different in many ways have different parents etc. Make your relationship central not your personal EGO's : If you really value the relationship and genuinely care for the other person its an easy choice.

fields.title: Keys to succeed in sports
fields.description:
Sometimes players stop at one level of their game. There is no improvement in their game. In such a situation, you should find a chance to play with players who are playing at a higher level than you and players who are playing better than you. Or consult a coach related to that game.

Sometimes players perform very well. But, they are not able to keep it. After 4 hours, 10 hours of practice in the field, we are unable to perform as needed. In that situation, do not be disappointed at all, have faith in yourself. Do not think about people at all. Keep the mind calm. And just focus on your game.

FORMULA OF SUCCESS IN SPORTS

You have to make a habit in your life. Watch the best performing videos on YouTube related to your game 1 to 2 hours before sleeping at night. And it has to be seen every day. Gradually you will start seeing good changes in your game.

If you are a football player, then watch videos of football well-performed game. If you play kabaddi, watch the video of kabaddis good performance. And if you bowler in cricket, then watch some videos of good bowling performance, if you are a batsman then watch videos of good batting.

The purpose behind this, when you do this. So you train your mind. Now understand it carefully, Something like this happens in the game. you have to take action within a few milliseconds. It is far to think.

To handle this situation, the brain has to be trained through these videos. Because within milliseconds your brain cannot think. According to the picture you have shown to your brain through the video, the brain automatically takes action without thinking.

The second reason, why are you have to watch videos of good performed games ( related to your sports) before going to sleep at night? Because watching the videos before bedtime, your subconscious mind works on it, after slipping.
fields.summary: The second reason, why are you have to watch videos of good performed games ( related to your sports) before going to sleep at night? Sometimes players stop at one level of their game.

fields.title: My favourite quote on success
fields.description:
The favorite quote , which is made by me is “ marks matters intelligency but intelligency never matters marks”

I made this quote when I was in first year b.com..A girl in Delhi got selected in IIT though she was not having such great marks in 12 science ,she was merely passing at very low marks …thus to prove that she is intelligent it doesn't require marks

When you are in school you are always judge by your marks…but why don't they ask for your intelligency..It is nothing to deal with marks..At last you can recover your marks if you are intelligent enough..

intelligence is not in one form..But it can be in many forms ..So never feel sorrow for your marks..As Indian education is corrupted one..

And at last “ when our ambition meets our goals it sets a perfect combination of success”..It is also an another quote by me..
